RSC configuration on Sun V240

  1. Front view of the V240
  2. Rear view of the V240
  3. Top open view of the V240
  4. Cable up the RSC port (Also called Net management port ) to a 10/100 Ethernet Switch.
  5. Configure the network on RSC. Login as root
    /usr/platform/`uname -i`/sbin/scadm set if_network true
/usr/platform/`uname -i`/sbin/scadm set netsc_ipaddr 10.34.64.X
/usr/platform/`uname -i`/sbin/scadm set netsc_ipnetmask 255.255.254.0
/usr/platform/`uname -i`/sbin/scadm set netsc_ipgateway 10.34.64.1
  6. Check the settings
    /usr/platform/`uname -i`/sbin/scadm show | grep netsc
  7. Set password for the admin user
    /usr/platform/`uname -i`/sbin/scadm  userpassword admin
  8. Reset the ALOM using this command
    /usr/platform/`uname -i`/sbin/scadm resetrsc
  9. telnet to the RSC port and login as admin.
  10. Use the console command to get to the console
    console

    or 

    console -f
  11. Some useful commands are
    poweron
poweroff
reset
break
flashupdate
  12. You may need to take the system down to redefine the console sometimes and at the ok prompt
    diag-console rsc
setenv input-device rsc-console
setenv output-device rsc-console

    OR do this so the next reboot will take care of it 

    eeprom input-device=rsc-console
eeprom output-device=rsc-console
